publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4052# Christine May: New Powers for Credit Unions—That the Parliament welcomes the extended facilities available to credit unions from April 2006 which will allow them to offer a wider range of services to their members; notes that these facilities will include insurance products, budgeting and savings accounts and flexible low-cost loans based on ability to pay; recognises the importance of the role played by credit unions in helping to alleviate poverty, prevent debt and its devastating consequences for many low income families, encourage saving and prudent borrowing and support regeneration in many communities across Scotland, such as Glenrothes and Levenmouth in Fife; further welcomes the additional support provided for approved credit unions to establish and administer these services; acknowledges that the credit union movement embodies and promotes the principles of mutualism and co-operation, and believes that the expansion of the credit union network in Scotland will play a vital part in enabling regeneration of many more communities. Supported by: Helen Eadie*, Bristow Muldoon*, Phil Gallie*, Alasdair Morgan*, Trish Godman*, Jackie Baillie*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Marilyn Livingstone*, Richard Baker*, Christine Grahame*, Sarah Boyack*, Bill Butler*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Bruce Crawford*, Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Mary Scanlon*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Charlie Gordon*, Cathie Craigie*, Patrick Harvie*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*

S2M-4052# Christine May: New Powers for Credit Unions—That the Parliament welcomes the extended facilities available to credit unions from April 2006 which will allow them to offer a wider range of services to their members; notes that these facilities will include insurance products, budgeting and savings accounts and flexible low-cost loans based on ability to pay; recognises the importance of the role played by credit unions in helping to alleviate poverty, prevent debt and its devastating consequences for many low income families, encourage saving and prudent borrowing and support regeneration in many communities across Scotland, such as Glenrothes and Levenmouth in Fife; further welcomes the additional support provided for approved credit unions to establish and administer these services; acknowledges that the credit union movement embodies and promotes the principles of mutualism and co-operation, and believes that the expansion of the credit union network in Scotland will play a vital part in enabling regeneration of many more communities. Supported by: Helen Eadie, Bristow Muldoon, Phil Gallie, Alasdair Morgan, Trish Godman, Jackie Baillie, Mr Jamie Stone, Marilyn Livingstone, Richard Baker, Christine Grahame, Sarah Boyack, Bill Butler, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Dr Elaine Murray, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Frank McAveety, Bruce Crawford, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Mary Scanlon, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Charlie Gordon, Cathie Craigie, Patrick Harvie, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Brian Adam*, Tricia Marwick*, Susan Deacon*, Nora Radcliffe*, Pauline McNeill*
S2M-4052# New Powers for Credit Unions (lodged on 2 March 2006) Rob Gibson*, Paul Martin*, Scott Barrie*
S2M-4052# New Powers for Credit Unions (lodged on 2 March 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4052# New Powers for Credit Unions (lodged on 2 March 2006) Cathy Peattie*
S2M-4052# New Powers for Credit Unions (lodged on 2 March 2006) Irene Oldfather*
S2M-4052# New Powers for Credit Unions (lodged on 2 March 2006) Mark Ballard*
S2M-4052# New Powers for Credit Unions (lodged on 2 March 2006) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-4052# New Powers for Credit Unions (lodged on 2 March 2006) Marlyn Glen*, Michael McMahon*, Karen Whitefield*, Karen Gillon*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Stewart Stevenson*, Ms Sandra White*, Kate Maclean*

S2M-4052# Christine May: New Powers for Credit Unions—That the Parliament welcomes the extended facilities available to credit unions from April 2006 which will allow them to offer a wider range of services to their members; notes that these facilities will include insurance products, budgeting and savings accounts and flexible low-cost loans based on ability to pay; recognises the importance of the role played by credit unions in helping to alleviate poverty, prevent debt and its devastating consequences for many low income families, encourage saving and prudent borrowing and support regeneration in many communities across Scotland, such as Glenrothes and Levenmouth in Fife; further welcomes the additional support provided for approved credit unions to establish and administer these services; acknowledges that the credit union movement embodies and promotes the principles of mutualism and co-operation, and believes that the expansion of the credit union network in Scotland will play a vital part in enabling regeneration of many more communities. Supported by: Helen Eadie, Bristow Muldoon, Phil Gallie, Alasdair Morgan, Trish Godman, Jackie Baillie, Mr Jamie Stone, Marilyn Livingstone, Richard Baker, Christine Grahame, Sarah Boyack, Bill Butler, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Dr Elaine Murray, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Mr Frank McAveety, Bruce Crawford, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Charlie Gordon, Cathie Craigie, Patrick Harvie, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Brian Adam, Tricia Marwick, Susan Deacon, Nora Radcliffe, Pauline McNeill, Rob Gibson, Paul Martin, Scott Barrie, Donald Gorrie, Cathy Peattie, Irene Oldfather, Mark Ballard, Linda Fabiani, Marlyn Glen, Michael McMahon, Karen Whitefield, Karen Gillon, Mr Adam Ingram, Stewart Stevenson, Ms Sandra White, Kate Maclean, Robin Harper*, John Scott* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
